attributes.action: Demand a formal independence referendum for Catalonia
attributes.background: The behaviour of the Spanish national police and Guardia Civil in relation to the Catalonian independence referendum is shocking and has no place in a Western democracy. The British government should stand with the Catalan people and demand a free and fair referendum on their independence from Spain
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/oct/01/dozens-injured-as-riot-police-storm-catalan-ref-polling-stations

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-41461032

The Spanish authorities have undertaken what amounts to a violent crackdown on people attempting to exercise their democratic right to self-determination. Even the court findings that the vote is illegal do not justify violence by police against peaceful citizens.

attributes.action: Rejoin the European Union in April 2019
attributes.background: The European Union consists of over 20 nations working to make a better life both for their citizens, and for the whole world. It offers fantastic trading opportunities as the largest free-trade area in the world. The international status and prestige of the UK would be enhanced by membership.
attributes.additional_details:
In June 2016 the people of the UK voted to leave the European Union. The government has repeated stated that it will respect this, and the the UK will leave the European Union, it will not debate whether the will of the people has changed, nor will it consider a referendum once the details of how the UK leaves become clear.

This petition proposes that the UK will leave the European Union. It will not rejoin by the back-door. We will join as any nation, with full public oversight.

attributes.action: Introduce a tourist tax in London - similar to the likes of New York and Naples.
attributes.background: Introducing a tourist tax would increase funds available in the capital for a whole range of issues - from tackling homelessness to improving existing infrastructure.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of time from 5 years to 3 for a divorce without consent.
attributes.background: You can divorce with their consent after 2 years separation but if they decide not to consent you then have to wait 5 years and you can divorce without their consent. 5 years is too long and more than double the 2 years with consent.

attributes.action: Make it law for every alcohol transaction to require approved photo ID
attributes.background: Many shop assistants every day are physically or verbally abused for asking for proof of age when purchasing alcohol a simple change to the law requiring that approved ID must be shown for every transaction would help reduce attempted under age purchases and remove cashier errors in assessing age
attributes.additional_details:
A simple law that states no ID no sale on alcohol would remove the possibility of human error in judging people's ages and would help to Reduce verbal and physical confrontations if customers knew the law was no ID no sale.
Across the country workers have been subjected to abuse because of guessing a customers age who subsequently causes a scene in an attempt to intimidate the cashier into selling the product.
A No ID no sale law would be a simple fix so everyone knows where they stand.

attributes.action: Make all advertisers state if their images have been doctored.
attributes.background: Both France and Israel have made it law that advertisers must put on their packaging that their images have been doctored. This is to stop the presentation of false body image. Britain should follow in their example.
attributes.additional_details: Recently, there have been instances where celebrities such as Kate Winlslet have made it public that images of them have been doctored. It should not be up to the models and celebrities to state this. There are countless doctored images that the public aren't aware about, that are constantly thrown in our faces. Advertisers should clearly state that their images have been doctored, as this can give some people the need to get the perfect body, which is obviously made up by some advertisers.

attributes.action: Stop companies asking for payment details for free trials of services.
attributes.background: For Free trials of services companies request payment details for the said trials. Failure to terminate at the end of a trial would normal mean services are charged for the next billing period. They should provide a option to terminate at point of  registering for free trail or terminate at expiry
attributes.additional_details:
Netflix
Linked in 
NOW TV  and so many more
They are all are relying on some income from those that forget to terminate. A free trial in good faith would not require payment method. It should be illegal not to auto terminate or give the option to terminate at the point of registering

attributes.action: Include the Welsh dragon onto the Union Jack.
attributes.background: For centuries Wales has been brutally ignored from our nation's flag. We with a voice must feel empowered to speak up against this disgrace. In November 2007 the House of Commons discussed this however no follow up action has been executed. We must take action and be proud of our heritage!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-25222891 Here is a fantastic list of examples of how the UK should represent the beautiful country of Wales. 
IMG_7543.JPG

attributes.action: Agree to change the law to tag all potential terrorists.
attributes.background: Currently it takes 20 agents to follow 1 terrorist suspect. If there are 300 or 5000 or 20000 people of interest in our communities, our agents have to prioritise who to follow, clearly leaving potential huge risks to the British population of more attacks (5 successful attacks since March).
attributes.additional_details: The ordinary British public have had a enough of wishy washy handling of these attacks being told to carry on as normal. How can we? We need to see some action which provides this nation with security. If you can’t intern them due to political correctness then tag them.

attributes.action: To make a new Act of Parliament, namely, The Protection from Online Bullying Act
attributes.background:
Online Bullying has become very wide spread on social media and educational forums causing emotional and psychological suffering, and in some cases even suicide.  
It is not enough to report online bullying, the Search Engines need to be compelled to have sanctions in place to deter the bullies.
attributes.additional_details:
Because there is not an specific Act in place to compel online bullies to behave in a reasonable way, their behaviour causes damage to people's lives, and, there needs to be a law with sanctions to prevent this from happening.
Without a  law to deter cyber-bullying with sanctions, it will snowball out of control, as the evidence in the media indicates.

attributes.action: Calculate student maintenance loans in a fairer way
attributes.background: Student maintenance loans are calculated on a household income basis. This method is not Fair as parents are expected to make up the rest but can’t with a bigger family. The aim of this is to have the loans be calculated by disposable income per person in the household rather than the overall income
attributes.additional_details: Maintenance loans are currently calculated by household income rather than disposable income per person, meaning that some students may get the same maintenance loan despite their parents being able to assist them more financially, as parents are expected to make up what we don’t get of the loan. This means an only child will have more support than someone with 3 younger siblings because their parents earn the same amount which isn’t fair as one family is more able to provide support

attributes.action: Increase pedestrian crossing times to enable disabled people to cross safely
attributes.background:
Often when I wait to cross the road and the green man appears, it goes off again whilst I'm only halfway through crossing - and I'm an able bodied person.

My father has MS and walks with a stick, meaning he and many other disabled people are not provided with enough time to safely cross the road.

attributes.action: Introduce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia
attributes.background: The Saudi state is notorious for its unjust and frankly disgusting treatment of women and LGBT people. It also massively restricts the civil liberties of its entire population. There is also evidence that suggests Saudi donors sponsor terrorism. We cannot support governments of this sort.
attributes.additional_details:
From gov.uk: 
"It’s illegal for women to drive."
"Homosexual acts and extra-marital sexual relations, including adultery, are illegal and can be subject to severe penalties."
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge"

A series of leaks from the then-Secretary of State Hillary Clinton's emails suggested that Saudi donors fund extremism.
A number of mosques found to be preaching extremist Wahhabism have been said to be linked to Saudi organisations.

attributes.action: Support the secession of Catalonia from The Kingdom of Spain
attributes.background: The people of Catalonia have voted overwhelmingly to leave Spain despite the attempts of the Spanish Government to stop them. The United Kingdom should recognize the will of the Catalan people and support their peaceful secession from the Kingdom of Spain along with recognizing their independence.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom respected the will of the Scottish people to hold a referendum and when the result came they respected that as well. The Spanish government has failed miserably to do either of these things. The UK, as a nation which respects the wishes of it's minorities should thus support the Catalan bid for independence and recognize their independence if they chose to declare it. They should also aid the diplomatic efforts to secure a peaceful secession of Catalonia.

attributes.action: Ban gambling advertising in the UK.
attributes.background: I am 26 years old and I already know over ten people who have been near crippled by gambling addiction. The fact that gambling is advertised is disgusting and should be held in the same regard as other addictive substances which get abused by people with poor mental health.
attributes.additional_details: The adverts that we see on the television take advantage of people's weaknesses, use of apps in spare time, inability to be alone or bored and position gambling as a 'light-hearted', 'sociable' way of passing the time. The actual potential that gambling had to ruin people's lives and the lives of their families and friends is catastrophic. There needs to be more onus placed on centralised government's responsibility to stopping this happening.

attributes.action: To bring back compulsory retirement age, so people can give way for others.
attributes.background: I started work in 1971 at  the age of 15, anyone approaching 60 & 65 had to retire. Work in my town was plentiful you could finish in one job and the next day you could start another if you wanted work. Work was for all people if a person had special needs they to could get paid work no bother.
attributes.additional_details: We had so many manufactures clothes, wagons, chocolates, cotton, wool, carpets, cakes, leather goods, records, coal, steel, light bulbs, engineering and mail order to name just a few. In 1970 the population was 55.66 million, today it is 65,51 an increase of over 10 million, Worldmeters report. Now most of the work as been out sourced to other countriesleaving some towns and cities with little work. We need to make way for others who have yet to experience paid work, and the same opportunities.

attributes.action: The council  to provide 24/7 childcare service to enable anyone access to work.
attributes.background: I am a single parent trying to do evening classes and work, however I am finding it impossible to access registered childcare after 6pm or weekends.  I have spoken with the head teachers in schools and they also agree that they all have many parents who don't have support,  nurses, or shift-workers.
attributes.additional_details:
Childcare could be provided by the council 24/7 and staff located in any area.  This means people can work in extended jobs and is important in many sectors of work.  The private childcare arrangements is not supportive and last minute emergencies is unobtainable. 
If the council provided help with limit of children and let the establishment grow then it will provide more work to qualified childcare support and enable parents to work and not be discriminated against as currently they are.

attributes.action: Driving licence: Introduce mandatory re-training/re-examination every 5-10y
attributes.background: Driving tech, laws, training & examination changes/improves, as such, we should introduce mandatory re-skilling/examination to ensure all drivers are up to par also allowing removal of drivers from the road whom would not meet modern driving skill/knowlege requirements to make our roads safer.
attributes.additional_details: We live in an age where someone could have passed their test 50 years ago, and not have any of the modern driving skills or knowledge that is imparted onto modern drivers, all drivers should have to be kept "up to skill" to ensure they are safe road users.

attributes.action: Install ANPR systems on the A2 junction with the A282.
attributes.background: Drivers bypass the A282 by using the A2 junction roundabout and then the A225 junction when the traffic is bad. This causes severe delays to Dartford residents going about their daily business. Drivers doing this show no consideration to other drivers and they should be fined for using this dodge.
attributes.additional_details: I live in DA1 and it once took 45 minutes to get to Asda Greenhithe because of this level of inconsiderate driving. Yesterday it accounted for nearly 20 minutes of delay because of HGV drivers blocking the A225 Princes Road junction with the roundabout. Local residents have the right to go about their daily business without the fear of being delayed by such inconsiderate drivers, who are only interested in themselves. Plus there are frequent law infringements on this roundabout.

attributes.action: Introduce Black History to the primary curriculum.
attributes.background:
To make Black History part of the school curriculum for Primary education such as It helps to enrich the development of the spiritual, moral, social and cultural needs of all ethnic groups.

We believe Black History should be made a mandatory element of the national curriculum.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health Education Compulsory in UK Schools
attributes.background: Despite increasingly high rates of mental illness in young people, mental health education isn’t compulsory in UK schools. Education is a vital component in increasing knowledge and awareness, encouraging open discussion among young people and giving them the power to ask for help when they need it.
attributes.additional_details:
Our initial campaign commissioned 2 polls:

• 80% of British parents believe child mental health is a top concern & 79% believe children should be taught about mental health (YouGov)
• 92% of 14-18 y/o think mental health should be taught at school. 65% said lack of knowledge meant they wouldn’t know if they were having issues (Censuswide)

Over 30 UK clinical psychologists & psychiatrists wrote to the government to make mental health education compulsory (The Times)

www.headucationuk.org
attributes.creator_name: Hannah Trimble, on behalf of The Shaw Mind Foundation

attributes.action: Be illegal to drive tractors on A roads between the hours of 8am to 7pm
attributes.background: Tractors and other slow moving farm vehicles are a menice to other road users due to them causing large tailbacks which make people take risks to over take.

attributes.action: Force the Government to fully fund the RNLI
attributes.background: in Britain we are one of the few countries that do not fund the Royal National lifeboat Association  and it is a scandal that we have to donate to something that should be provided as a government funded service.
attributes.additional_details: I was recently told by a lifeboat crew member that the service costs about £160m a year to finance, this is a a tiny amount when you look at government spending on say consultants, why are we allowing this travesty to continue.

attributes.action: Zero Rate all School Uniform for VAT regardless of size.
attributes.background: Children’s clothing is zero rated for VAT depending on size. But, larger school uniform is zero rated for children under 14 if it is unique to a school. No child can leave school before age 16, so this is unfair.  All customized school uniform, should be zero-rated, regardless of age.

attributes.action: No cash transaction after 2025-30
attributes.background:
It would eliminate “black markets” and allow easier monetary policy.
Underground economy in the UK is worth +/- £150bn a year.
It could easily solve problems with the NHS, social housing, investment in research, education etc.
attributes.additional_details:
It would help to “wipe off “ undeclared work and organised crime income.
Cash transactions are less popular each year.
Let’s make the UK a leader and be the first Cashless Nation.

attributes.action: To stop lorries/buses overtaking on A roads and Motorways to reduce congestion.
attributes.background: The main problem on motorways is congestions and crashes. The problem is lorries are trying to overtake each other which takes too long which means the flow of traffic slows and causes congestion and crashes. It would stop the middle lane slowing which makes more cars stay in the middle lane.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/speed-limits

Above are the speed limits of vehicles over 7.5 tonnes to 60 mph which is 10 mph slower than the motorway speed.

attributes.action: Put aspects of gardening onto the Primary curriculum, teaching its benefits.
attributes.background: I introduced a motion on a similar topic at a Teachers' Conference last year, which gained much national publicity. Not all schools have a garden but all can do something in aa container or similar. Help can be given by the RHS Campaign for School Gardening and similar campaigns.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence shows that outdoor learning can improve the mental health of particpants, and introducing children to New healthy foods can help to reduce obesity.

attributes.action: Prevent the current changes to pharmacy regulations being debated by the DoH
attributes.background: The planned changes to pharmacy regulations aim to allow a pharmacy to open and allow prescription-only medicines to be given out without a Responsible Pharmacist present. This will inevitably result in both patient harm and reduced access to pharmacy services for patients.
attributes.additional_details: The government has said that they wish to "better utilise the skills of pharmacists in healthcare settings such as hospitals and GP practices", but have put no proposals forward to guarantee jobs for the many community pharmacists and Locums that this will put out of work. People who have been at the heart of the community helping patients will now find themselves without work, and those patients will find they have reduced access to pharmacy services.

attributes.action: Increase the student loan repayment threshold for all graduates (Type 1 Loan)
attributes.background: Type 2 (Post sep 2012 students) student loans have recently had a threshold increase to £25000. Now pre Sep 2012 starters pay 9% contributions on every single penny above £17,775. If a grad from 2014 and 15 both earned 25k. Then the grad from 2014 would earn (Gross) £650.25 less than the 2015 grad.
attributes.additional_details:
This could be the difference between being approved for a mortgage or refused. 

Considering only the top 23% of graduates pay their loans back within 30 years. We want the government to help all graduates and make the threshold for all student loans the same. 

It could be suggested its just another kick in the teeth for millennials who were born a decade late for affordable housing. 

https://www.moneysavingexpert.com/news/family/2017/10/victory-for-graduates-student-loan-repayment-threshold

attributes.action: Review the share of Government money spent on Northamptonshire services
attributes.background:
Several ​le​ss-deprived counties ​get much more spent on them per head than​ Northamptonshire​, mainly due to an out-of-date funding model​.

We need a fairer allocation scheme to better reflect today’s population growth and levels of deprivation in Northamptonshire.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to properly fund our roads, child social care, police, NHS and fire service and look after our elderly people. All of these are falling further behind other counties every year.

Surrey gets £134 more per person​ this year despite being considerably ​less needy, according to Government statistics.

The Local Government Association says Northamptonshire is the county least able to fund itself in the future.

attributes.action: The UK government should impose economic sanctions on Spain over Catalonia.
attributes.background: On 1st October 2017 the people of Catalonia voted for independence despite attempts by the central Spanish government to prevent the referendum. Scenes were shown across the media of the brutality shown towards Catalonia citizens, but the UK's response since has been shameful.
attributes.additional_details: A fundamental British value (or so we teach our children) is the importance of democracy. A right to vote and determine the future of your own people is a right protected under the European Convention on Human Rights and a pre-requisite of EU membership, not to mention the hallmark of a fair and free society. The UK government's response should recognise this by imposing sanctions against Spain or taking other diplomatic steps to secure the rights of the Catalonian people.

attributes.action: The history of Communism should be introduced into the GCSE history curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that communism is an important part of international history and will educate students of the united kingdom on the past and present.
attributes.additional_details: I have done a survey in my school which has shown that pupils have an interest in this subject and wish to learn more.

attributes.action:
Award H/B so rents paid in full to parents/sons/daughters over 18
M/Severe ASD
attributes.background: No discrimination in H/Benefit.Rent for parents with children over 18 who have moderate to severe Autism Spectrum disorder should be paid in full as thousands of parents cannot work and are stuck on benefits due to lack of support as their young adult doesn't have the capacity to live independently.
attributes.additional_details:
My son is now 20 years old and does not have full coherency. I have singular guardianship. He receives very little support and I receive the same 10 hrs. At the last meeting social services wanted to 
drop those hours by a further 4. I cannot work because I am my sons 
full time carer, meaning I am forced to remain on benefits. I have rent & bills to pay not to mention ensuring that their are hearty meals on the table for a growing lad. My housing benefit doesn't cut it do S/Fall's still £374 pm

attributes.action: Working week to be split 40/60, weekend (Fri-Sun) weekday (Mon-Thurs)
attributes.background: I believe this should be considered with great thought as I think we over work ourseleves during the week and dont get enough breathing space to enjoy our own time and time with our familes, overworking can lead to mental and physical health issues so I believe this can help fix that.

attributes.action: Re-open the Dubs scheme to allow unaccompanied child refugees entry into the UK
attributes.background: The Government announced in February that it would close the Dubs scheme – intended to grant 3000 vulnerable unaccompanied minors a safe passage to Britain – after accepting just 350. We are capable of taking thousands more. Sign to call for the scheme to be reopened & help these desperate children.
attributes.additional_details: FOI requests have shown that local councils have voluntarily offered to accept 1572 more children than are currently being supported, yet the Government is refusing to accept any more child refugees from the continent. The longer this goes on the more likely it is that children will go missing & fall into the hands of traffickers. Our values of openness & tolerance mean that we have a duty to be a land of sanctuary to these vulnerable children. The Government must act now and re-open the scheme.

attributes.action: Have a general election before summer term 2018
attributes.background: At this time of political uncertainty, Britain needs to have a clear leader and a strong party to back them up. At the moment, the country doesn’t have a party with a strong mandate or a certain one. I believe that we need a chance for all political parties to present to us their arguments.
attributes.additional_details: So that we can decided clearly and indecisively who runs The U.K. This last general election failed us. The Conservative party clearly Expected to win and didn’t present their side, and labour fought but didn’t give a clear plan for their brexit, however now that Labour, like the Conservatives, have clarified their brexit strategy we, the British people deserve to make a choice, to benefit is locally and nationally.

attributes.action: Change the way in which eligibility for child benefit is calculated for couples.
attributes.background: Currently eligibility for child benefit for couples is calculated on the highest earners salary and taxable benefits.  Basically the higher earner is accountable for taxes if earning over 50k regardless of the salary of the lower earner.  For couples with one higher earner the formula is unfair.
attributes.additional_details: A couple with 2 incomes of 49k combined 98k inclusive of taxable benefits will be entitled to full child benefit and no taxation on either earner.  Where as for a couple with one higher earner for example 58k incl taxable benefits and one lower earner say 6k combined 64k.  Would still be entitled to child benefit however the higher earner would be subject to taxation.  For a family with 3 children the benefit would be 2.5k/yr with tax of 2.4k/yr.  This simply is not fair and needs reform.

attributes.action: Increase efficiency of motorways by permitting overtaking on the left.
attributes.background: The UK motorway network is one of the most congested in Europe. The UK government are spending £ millions implementing "smart motorways" to help increase efficiency. The problem is NOT just volume of traffic, but because motorists don't abide by Highway code rule 264 leading to 'empty lanes'.
attributes.additional_details: Penalties to motorists ignoring rule 264 (keeping in the left lane unless overtaking) were introduced, but the decrease in motorway police patrols means this rarely enforced. Many motorists still habitually drive in Lane 2 while Lane 1 is empty;this forces all faster moving traffic into Lane 3 so becomes full 'nose to tail' and motorways operate below optimum capacity. By allowing overtaking on the left (as the USA) ALL lanes of motorways would be fully utilised to increase capacity at no cost.

attributes.action: Make access to food, clothes and shelter a human right, enshrined in law.
attributes.background: Poverty is a very real phenomonon for many in the UK today and the inequality gap between the rich and the poor continues to widen. Lets underline the boundaries of our civilisation. Too many people will sleep in the street this winter. Lets end homelessness and hunger in the UK, 1 meal at a time.
attributes.additional_details: I am a citizen, with a voice and a computer.  I just can't continue to pass the increasing number of people on the street and try to give them change for a cup of tea without recognising that the problem needs to be tackled strategically/politically.  I also worked as a health visitor and saw first hand how many families don,t have consistent access to meals.  The problem is huge and needs a strategic response at a national level.  Food, clothes and shelter for all is not too much to ask.

attributes.action: Get Government to give social services more money
attributes.background: I got brought into foster care in 2008 and throughout the years I have seen how the lack of funding has affected how these services have worked. Social workers are given over 30 young people to look after when the most they should have is 16.Lack of funds means they can't give the service they want.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/sep/26/cuts-to-social-services-and-increased-tax-revenue-deliver-reduced-budget-defcit
We need more social workers yet they can't be hired because there isn't enough funding. The funding for social services has slowly been decreased until they're almost at breaking point now. Social workers are forced to leave vulnerable young people with carers without being introduced. Its harmful to the children and the parents and is causing emotional distress.

attributes.action: change workplace drugs tests. Oral mouth swabs should be the compulsory method.
attributes.background: Urine based testing is a demeaning and very personal method of testing. Oral mouth swabs is a easy and non-invasive method. It is the method used by police for road users and should be made the compulsory method for the workplace.
attributes.additional_details: Oral mouth swabs has the ability to detect drug use within the first few hours. This is a window of time that is omitted by urine tests. Mouth swabs, with their ability to detect drug use 1-4 days after use, are the best method for impairment and post-accident testing.

attributes.action: Make gender neutral uniforms compulsory in UK schools
attributes.background: Across the UK, children are unnecessarily, and directly discriminated against in schools, simply because of their gender. Despite various acts of parliament, schools in the UK are still able to dictate what a child of a certain gender can wear. This is most unfitting in 21st century Britain.
attributes.additional_details: However, British schools are prescribed to teach British values. Most notably, individual liberty, and mutual respect. Yet, such values are compromised if, for example, boys cannot wear skirts, or girls are unable to wear trousers. Not least, in some uniform policies boys cannot wear earrings, or possess long hair, whereas girls at the same institution can. Such uniforms also put those children who do not identify as either a boy, or a girl at risk. Attitudes towards gender need to change.

attributes.action: Make more council houses and flats
attributes.background: There are to many family's and single people suffering about not having homes we need to make sure that nobody should be homeless in this day and age families or people should feel safe
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken to people living on the streets also have seen to many programmes on this subject the government needs to take action

attributes.action: Abusive partners should lose the privilege to have contact with their child(ren)
attributes.background: Abusive partners should lose the privilege to have contact with their child(ren) if the mother is forced to flee domestic abuse whilst she is pregnant or whilst the child is too young to choose for themselves.
attributes.additional_details: Abusive ex partners also use children as a gateway back into their victims life. Safeguarding restrictions being put in place is not sufficient. If the child has contact with the abusive parent, they are very likely to be exposed to domestic abuse when observing the parent in future relationships. This can be damaging and is not in a child's best interest. The abuser may also abuse the child or use the child to indirectly continue to abuse their ex partner.

attributes.action: The UK must expel the North Korean ambassador
attributes.background:
North Korea is a rogue state threatening the entire world.  They are extreme cybercriminals, exporters of terrorism, and have now ramped up their nuclear weapons programme in defiance of UN sanctions and international outcry.

We must send a strong message by expelling their ambassador.
attributes.additional_details:
Other countries which have expelled their North Korean ambassador include: Spain; Kuwait; Peru; Mexico; and Botswana.  Meanwhile Egypt, the Philippines, and Uganda have drastically scaled back diplomatic ties.

London has an (est. 20,000) Korean community from both North and South.  North Korean "enforcers" spy on this community as well as locals (who aren't always Korean) near the embassy, intimidating people who joke about the country or regime.

They shouldn't benefit from life in London.

attributes.action: scrap 'smart' motorways and revert to a hard shoulder
attributes.background: So called 'smart' motorways are anything but smart . A small refuge that can barely accommodate an HGV . Cars do not breakdown always where there is a refuge available . There is no facility for cars/lorries to re-join at motorway speed . Cars breaking down in the 4th lane are sitting ducks .

attributes.action: Allow everyone over 55 flexibility to manage their private pension
attributes.background: The Pension Schemes Act 2015 allowed individuals from the age of 55 to be able to access their pension flexibility if they wish, but not if you had already accessed your pension prior to the new Act coming into force. I want this Government to give us the same rights to manage our pension as we wish

attributes.action: Scrap the tampon tax. Reduce the price of all sanitary products.
attributes.background: Women spend on average £13 a month on sanitary products. Some women have to chose between food and sanitary products. Women don't make the choice to have a period. It is not a luxury but the government classes it as one.
attributes.additional_details: There is  5% tax on sanitary products. Condoms are given out for free whereas there is a tax on sanitary products.  You can choose to abstain from sex but you can't help having a period.

attributes.action: No Clock Changes: Maintain British Summer Time through the year
attributes.background: Changing clocks twice a year is a stupid, inefficient and outdated practice.
attributes.additional_details: Scotland could have its own separate time if it needs to.

attributes.action: Formally support UN condemnation of the Saudi bloc's demand to close Al Jazeera.
attributes.background: A UN High Commissioner has condemned the Saudi-led bloc's demand to close Al Jazeera as an "unacceptable attack on the right to freedom of expression and opinion". The government should explicitly support the UN and oppose the Salman regime's attempt to censor TV channels available in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The UN High Commissioner is Zeid Ra'ad al-Hussein:
http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/06/high-commissioner-zeid-raad-al-hussein-call-shut-al-jazeera-unacceptable-attack-170630111642647.html

It is unacceptable to tolerate Saudi interference in what British audiences should be permitted to watch. The government should issue a formal declaration of support for the UN and unequivocally repudiate such Saudi meddling in our sources of news. It is not for the Saudis to censor our television channels.
